page.title: 01A summary of our area.
page.content: Our area is primarily agricultural. There is only one village and that is Shipbourne,which is 4 miles North of Tonbridge,the other houses and farms are widly spread over the area. Most of our area is arable and pasture land but there is some woodland.There is pasture in the West because there is lots of clay soil which becomes water-logged so it is not suitable for arable crops.The animals that graze are mostly cows and sheep,but there are also horses and donkeys.Because there is good soil around Shipbourne crops like wheat,barley,oats,peas, beans and rape can be grown.The woodland contains coniferous and deciduous trees. There are 3 establishments for the disabled and handicapped. The area has a poor bus service, most people commute to work by car. Deborah
